exceptions.exn: Abstracting over the term "n" leads to a term fun n0 : nat => pos_both n0 m (pos_left m p) = inl p which is ill-typed. Reason is: Illegal application: The term "pos_left" of type "forall n m : nat, pos n -> pos (n + m)" cannot be applied to the terms "n0" : "nat" "m" : "nat" "p" : "pos n" The 3rd term has type "pos n" which should be coercible to "pos n0".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
m: nat
n: nat
p: pos n

Goal:
pos_both n m (pos_left m p) = inl p

Premises:
Inductive sum (A B : Type) : Type := inl : A -> A + B | inr : B -> A + B Arguments sum (_ _)%type_scope Arguments inl {A B}%type_scope, [A] _ _ Arguments inr {A B}%type_scope, _ [B] _
pos_both : forall n m : nat, pos (n + m) -> pos n + pos m
Notation pos := Fin.t
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
pos_left : forall n m : nat, pos n -> pos (n + m)
Nat.add_assoc : forall n m p : nat, n + (m + p) = n + m + p
Nat.add_cancel_r : forall n m p : nat, n + p = m + p < -> n = m
Nat.add_shuffle0 : forall n m p : nat, n + m + p = n + p + m
Fin.depair = fix depair (m n : nat) (o : pos m) (p : pos n) {struct o} : pos (m * n) := match o in (pos n0) return (pos (n0 * n)) with | @Fin.F1 m' => Fin.L (m' * n) p | @Fin.FS n0 o' => Fin.R n (depair n0 n o' p) end : forall m n : nat, pos m -> pos n -> pos (m * n) Arguments Fin.depair {m n}%nat_scope
pow2_fix1 : forall p : nat, pow2 (S p) = 2 * pow2 p
BinIntDef.Z.div2 = fun z : BinNums.Z => match z with | BinNums.Zpos (BinNums.xI _ as p) | BinNums.Zpos (BinNums.xO _ as p) => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.div2 p) | BinNums.Zneg p => BinNums.Zneg (BinPos.Pos.div2_up p) | _ => BinNums.Z0 end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.div2 _%Z_scope
Fin.of_nat : forall p n : nat, pos n + {exists m : nat, p = n + m}
pos_iso : forall n m : nat, n = m -> pos n -> pos m
Fin.eqb_nat_eq : forall (m n : nat) (p : pos m) (q : pos n), Fin.eqb p q = true -> m = n
Nat.add_shuffle1 : forall n m p q : nat, n + m + (p + q) = n + p + (m + q)
VectorSpec.replace_id : forall (A : Type) (n : nat) (p : pos n) (v : VectorDef.t A n), VectorDef.replace v p (VectorDef.nth v p) = v
pos_O_inv = let pos_inv_t := fun n : nat => match n as x return (pos x -> Set) with | 0 => fun _ : pos 0 => False | S n0 => fun i : pos (S n0) => ((i = pos0) + {p : pos n0 | i = pos_nxt p})%type end in let pos_inv := fun (_tmp : nat) (p0 : pos _tmp) => match p0 as t in (pos n) return (pos_inv_t n t) with | @Fin.F1 n => inl eq_refl | @Fin.FS n p => inr (exist (fun p1 : pos n => pos_nxt p = pos_nxt p1) p eq_refl) end in pos_inv 0 : pos 0 -> False
Fin.of_nat_ext : forall h h' : ?p < ?n, Fin.of_nat_lt h = Fin.of_nat_lt h' where ?p : [n : nat m : nat p : pos n |- nat] ?n : [n : nat m : nat p : pos n |- nat]
Nat.lt_eq_cases : forall n m : nat, n <= m < -> n < m \/ n = m
gt_S : forall n m : nat, S n > m -> n > m \/ m = n
Nat.add_comm : forall n m : nat, n + m = m + n
Nat.divide_gcd_iff' : forall n m : nat, Nat.divide n m < -> Nat.gcd n m = n
Nat.mul_succ_r : forall n m : nat, n * S m = n * m + n
VectorSpec.eta : forall v : VectorDef.t ?A (S ?n), v = VectorDef.cons ?A (VectorDef.hd v) ?n (VectorDef.tl v) where ?A : [n : nat m : nat p : pos n |- Type] ?n : [n : nat m : nat p : pos n |- nat]
Nat.divide_gcd_iff : forall n m : nat, 0 <= n -> Nat.divide n m < -> Nat.gcd n m = n
VectorSpec.nth_map2 : forall (f : ?A -> ?B -> ?C) (n0 : nat) (v : VectorDef.t ?A n0) (w : VectorDef.t ?B n0) (p1 p2 p3 : pos n0), p1 = p2 -> p2 = p3 -> VectorDef.nth (VectorDef.map2 f v w) p1 = f (VectorDef.nth v p2) (VectorDef.nth w p3) where ?A : [n : nat m : nat p : pos n |- Type] ?B : [n : nat m : nat p : pos n |- Type] ?C : [n : nat m : nat p : pos n |- Type]
Nat.eqb_eq : forall n m : nat, (n =? m) = true < -> n = m
beq_nat_true : forall n m : nat, (n =? m) = true -> n = m
Fin.depair_sanity : forall (o : pos ?m) (p0 : pos ?n), proj1_sig (Fin.to_nat (Fin.depair o p0)) = ?n * proj1_sig (Fin.to_nat o) + proj1_sig (Fin.to_nat p0) where ?m : [n : nat m : nat p : pos n |- nat] ?n : [n : nat m : nat p : pos n |- nat]
Fin.FS_inj : forall x y : pos ?n, pos_nxt x = pos_nxt y -> x = y where ?n : [n : nat m : nat p : pos n |- nat]
VectorSpec.nth_map : forall (f : ?A -> ?B) (n0 : nat) (v : VectorDef.t ?A n0) (p1 p2 : pos n0), p1 = p2 -> VectorDef.nth (VectorDef.map f v) p1 = f (VectorDef.nth v p2) where ?A : [n : nat m : nat p : pos n |- Type] ?B : [n : nat m : nat p : pos n |- Type]
pos_S_inv : forall p0 : pos (S ?n), (p0 = pos0) + {q : pos ?n | p0 = pos_nxt q} where ?n : [n : nat m : nat p : pos n |- nat]
Fin.of_nat_to_nat_inv : forall p0 : pos ?m, Fin.of_nat_lt (proj2_sig (Fin.to_nat p0)) = p0 where ?m : [n : nat m : nat p : pos n |- nat]
Fin.cast : pos ?m -> forall n0 : nat, ?m = n0 -> pos n0 where ?m : [n : nat m : nat p : pos n |- nat]
Fin.to_nat_inj : forall p0 q : pos ?n, proj1_sig (Fin.to_nat p0) = proj1_sig (Fin.to_nat q) -> p0 = q where ?n : [n : nat m : nat p : pos n |- nat]
Fin.eq_dec : forall x y : pos ?n, {x = y} + {x <> y} where ?n : [n : nat m : nat p : pos n |- nat]
VectorDef.map2 : (?A -> ?B -> ?C) -> forall n0 : nat, VectorDef.t ?A n0 -> VectorDef.t ?B n0 -> VectorDef.t ?C n0 where ?A : [n : nat m : nat p : pos n |- Type] ?B : [n : nat m : nat p : pos n |- Type] ?C : [n : nat m : nat p : pos n |- Type]
pos_lr : forall n m : nat, pos n + pos m -> pos (n + m)
Fin.weak : forall p0 : nat, (pos ?m -> pos ?n) -> pos (p0 + ?m) -> pos (p0 + ?n) where ?m : [n : nat m : nat p : pos n |- nat] ?n : [n : nat m : nat p : pos n |- nat]
Fin.L_sanity : forall (n0 : nat) (p0 : pos ?m), proj1_sig (Fin.to_nat (Fin.L n0 p0)) = proj1_sig (Fin.to_nat p0) where ?m : [n : nat m : nat p : pos n |- nat]
BinNatDef.N.mul = fun n m : BinNums.N => match n with | BinNums.N0 => BinNums.N0 | BinNums.Npos p => match m with | BinNums.N0 => BinNums.N0 | BinNums.Npos q => BinNums.Npos (BinPos.Pos.mul p q) end end : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> BinNums.N Arguments BinNatDef.N.mul (_ _)%N_scope
VectorDef.map : (?A -> ?B) -> forall n0 : nat, VectorDef.t ?A n0 -> VectorDef.t ?B n0 where ?A : [n : nat m : nat p : pos n |- Type] ?B : [n : nat m : nat p : pos n |- Type]
Fin.R_sanity : forall (n0 : nat) (p0 : pos ?m), proj1_sig (Fin.to_nat (Fin.R n0 p0)) = n0 + proj1_sig (Fin.to_nat p0) where ?m : [n : nat m : nat p : pos n |- nat]
BinIntDef.Z.max = fun n m : BinNums.Z => match BinIntDef.Z.compare n m with | Lt => m | _ => n end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.max (_ _)%Z_scope
pos_right : forall n m : nat, pos m -> pos (n + m)

assert (H : n = n).  
{ reflexivity. }  
rewrite <- H.  
apply pos_both.
